referenceFunction.name: miscanthus-bales, at field
referenceFunction.includedProcesses: The inventory includes the processes of soil cultivation, sowing, weed control, fertilisation, pest and pathogen control, harvest and balling. Machine infrastructure and a shed for machine sheltering is included. Inputs of fertilisers, pesticides and planting stocks as well as their transports to the farm are considered. The direct emissions on the field are also included. The system boundary is the field.
referenceFunction.generalComment: Inventory refers to the production of 1 kg dry matter miscanthus-bales.

geography.text: Refers to an average production in Europe. Calculation based on inventory data for SE, PL, DE and GR. Production shares based on expert guess.

timePeriod.text: Starting point scenario for average agricultural and harvesting technology in the year 2004.

representativeness.samplingProcedure: Data were compiled by experts from Poland, Greece, Germany and Sweden from statistics, pilot network, fertilising recommendations, documents from extension services, information provided by retailers, literature and expert knowledge. The production data were verified and adjusted by the project team.

source.additionalAuthors: Faist Emmenegger M., Frischknecht R., Tuchschmid M.

referenceFunction.name: miscanthus-bales, scenario 1, at field
referenceFunction.includedProcesses: The inventory includes the processes of soil cultivation, sowing, weed control, fertilisation, pest and pathogen control, harvest and balling. Machine infrastructure and a shed for machine sheltering is included. Inputs of fertilisers, pesticides and planting stocks as well as their transports to the farm are considered. The direct emissions on the field are also included. The system boundary is the field.
referenceFunction.generalComment: Inventory refers to the production of 1 kg dry matter miscanthus-bales.

geography.text: Refers to an average production in Europe. Calculation based on inventory data for SE, PL, DE and GR. Production shares based on expert guess.

technology.text: Expert guess data for agricultural and harvesting technology in 2020

timePeriod.text: Scenario 1 for maximized biofuel production in the year 2020

representativeness.samplingProcedure: Data were compiled by experts from Poland, Greece, Germany and Sweden from statistics, pilot network, fertilising recommendations, documents from extension services, information provided by retailers, literature and expert knowledge. The production data were verified and adjusted by the project team.

source.additionalAuthors: Faist Emmenegger M., Frischknecht R., Tuchschmid M.

referenceFunction.name: miscanthus-bales, scenario 2, at field
referenceFunction.includedProcesses: The inventory includes the processes of soil cultivation, sowing, weed control, fertilisation, pest and pathogen control, harvest and balling. Machine infrastructure and a shed for machine sheltering is included. Inputs of fertilisers, pesticides and planting stocks as well as their transports to the farm are considered. The direct emissions on the field are also included. The system boundary is the field.
referenceFunction.generalComment: Inventory refers to the production of 1 kg dry matter miscanthus-bales.

geography.text: Refers to an average production in Europe. Calculation based on inventory data for SE, PL, DE and GR. Production shares based on expert guess.

technology.text: Expert guess data for agricultural and harvesting technology in 2020. Use of bioenergy in tractors.

timePeriod.text: Scenario 2 for self sufficient biofuel production in the year 2020.

representativeness.samplingProcedure: Data were compiled by experts from Poland, Greece, Germany and Sweden from statistics, pilot network, fertilising recommendations, documents from extension services, information provided by retailers, literature and expert knowledge. The production data were verified and adjusted by the project team.

source.additionalAuthors: Faist Emmenegger M., Frischknecht R., Tuchschmid M.

referenceFunction.name: planting stocks, miscanthus, at field
referenceFunction.includedProcesses: The inventory includes the processes of soil cultivation, sowing, weed control, fertilisation, pest and pathogen control, harvest and balling. Machine infrastructure and a shed for machine sheltering is included. Inputs of fertilisers, pesticides and planting stocks as well as their transports to the farm are considered. The direct emissions on the field are also included. The system boundary is the field.
referenceFunction.generalComment: Inventory refers to the production of 1 planting stock (1 unit).

geography.text: Refers to an average production in Europe. Calculation based on inventory data for SE, PL, DE and GR. Production shares based on expert guess.

timePeriod.text: Starting point scenario for average agricultural and harvesting technology in the year 2004.

representativeness.samplingProcedure: Data were compiled by experts from Poland, Greece, Germany and Sweden from statistics, pilot network, fertilising recommendations, documents from extension services, information provided by retailers, literature and expert knowledge. The production data were verified and adjusted by the project team.

source.additionalAuthors: Faist Emmenegger M., Frischknecht R., Tuchschmid M.
